perturbation.original_text: Neither the Franchisor, its Predecessor nor any person listed under Item 2 or an affiliate offering franchises under Franchisor's principal trademark:     (A) has an administrative, criminal or civil action pending against that person alleging: a felony; a violation of a franchise, antitrust or securities law; fraud; embezzlement; fraudulent conversion; misappropriation of property; unfair or deceptive practices; or comparable civil or misdemeanor allegations.
perturbation.changed_text: The Franchisor, its Predecessor, or any person listed under Item 2 or an affiliate offering franchises under Franchisor's principal trademark may have an administrative, criminal or civil action pending against that person alleging: a felony; a violation of a franchise, antitrust or securities law; fraud; embezzlement; fraudulent conversion; misappropriation of property; unfair or deceptive practices; or comparable civil or misdemeanor allegations. The existence of such actions shall not automatically disqualify them from offering franchises but will be considered on a case-by-case basis.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states the Franchisor 'has' no pending actions. The modified text directly contradicts this by stating the Franchisor 'may have' pending actions, thereby creating uncertainty and potentially impacting the franchisee's decision to invest.

perturbation.original_text: Neither the Franchisor, its affiliate, its predecessor, officers, or general partner during the ten year period immediately before the date of the disclosure document: (a) filed as debtor (or had filed against it) a petition to start an action under the U.S. Bankruptcy Code (or any comparable foreign law); (b) obtained a discharge of its debts under the bankruptcy code; or (c) was a principal officer of a company or a general partner in a partnership that either filed as a debtor (or had filed against it) a petition to start an action under the U.S. Bankruptcy Code or that obtained a discharge of its debts under the U.S. Bankruptcy Code during or within one year after the officer or general partner of the Franchisor held this position in the company or partnership.
perturbation.changed_text: The Franchisor, its affiliate, its predecessor, officers, or general partner during the ten year period immediately before the date of the disclosure document may have: (a) filed as debtor (or had filed against it) a petition to start an action under the U.S. Bankruptcy Code (or any comparable foreign law); (b) obtained a discharge of its debts under the bankruptcy code; or (c) was a principal officer of a company or a general partner in a partnership that either filed as a debtor (or had filed against it) a petition to start an action under the U.S. Bankruptcy Code or that obtained a discharge of its debts under the U.S. Bankruptcy Code during or within one year after the officer or general partner of the Franchisor held this position in the company or partnership. Such prior bankruptcy events do not automatically disqualify them from operating a franchise and will be evaluated based on current financial standing.
perturbation.explanation: The original text explicitly states that the Franchisor has not filed for bankruptcy. The modified text introduces a contradiction by suggesting that the Franchisor 'may have' filed for bankruptcy, directly contradicting the prior statement. This ambiguity regarding bankruptcy history creates enforcement issues and financial risks for the franchisee.

perturbation.changed_text: The following Items are required to be included within the Disclosure Document but shall not necessarily supersede the language in the Disclosure Document itself. The Franchisor reserves the right to interpret and apply the clauses in the Disclosure Document with its own discretion.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states that the Addendum items supersede the Disclosure Document. This contradiction creates uncertainty and enforcement issues.
